results.definition: forward in time or order or degree
near or toward the bow of a ship or cockpit of a plane
examples: the captain went fore (or forward) to check the instruments

results.definition: send or ship onward from an intermediate post or station in transit
at or to or toward the front

examples: they went slowly forward in the mud

results.definition: toward the future; forward in time
examples: I look forward to seeing you

results.definition: a position on a basketball, soccer, or hockey team
at or near or directed toward the front
examples: the forward section of the aircraft
a forward plunge down the stairs

results.definition: the person who plays the position of forward in certain games, such as basketball, soccer, or hockey
used of temperament or behavior; lacking restraint or modesty
examples: a forward child badly in need of discipline

results.definition: of the transmission gear causing forward movement in a motor vehicle
